instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD1: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD1? PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 is a power rail that powers the soldered on SSDs.
definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD1</SIGNAL> was shorted
threads.message:
Board had a short on <CAPACITOR>C9588</CAPACITOR> from some corrosion, <CHIP>U9580</CHIP> was also shot, after replacing those board gets up to 20v and 0.48a but comes back to 20v and 0.01a, while trying to start I can see that all NAND chips and T2 heat up a bit while the board is near 0.48a, the information on this board is important.

I'm just now starting to use the oscilloscope
When I check L9581 on the oscilloscope it works fine once the board has the 20v and even when it goes down to 0.01a, L9580 only works for a few seconds after the board gets 20v then it stops, both have the expected 2.5v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD1</SIGNAL> was shorted
threads.message:
Ok nevermind, this board is working now, this is my first T2 board and I did not know it was turning on, for some reason I thought the startup behavior was the same as say 2016-2017 and it is not.

To avoid this in the future how do I know when a T2 board is fixed?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD1</SIGNAL> was shorted
threads.message: On a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> the startup power is as shown in the image attached, for some reason I thought I would be about the same...
